sentences.en: A unity invariably tends to break up into different parts.
sentences.cn: 统一体总要分解为不同部分的.

sentences.en: Acupuncture treatment is gentle, painless, and, invariably, most relaxing.
sentences.cn: 针灸疗法柔和，无痛，而且总是令人非常放松。

sentences.en: After her meal she invariably rinsed out her mouth.
All things invariably divide into two.
He was invariably willing to discuss the possibilities hypothetically.
sentences.cn: 他总是愿意谈论各种假设的可能性。

sentences.en: He would invariably find some excuses.
It invariably rains when he goes there.
sentences.cn: 他去那里时天总是下雨.

sentences.en: It invariably rains when I go there.
Neither of them is telling the whole truth. Invariably, they keep something back.
sentences.cn: 他俩谁也没把全部实情都说出来。他们总是要隐瞒些什么。

sentences.en: Obsessives, in any area, are invariably as boring as their hobbies.
sentences.cn: 无论在哪个领域，过分痴迷者都会跟他们的癖好一样令人厌烦。

sentences.en: Summer clothes are invariably less kind to fuller figures.
sentences.cn: 体形较丰满的人穿夏装总是不那么好看。

sentences.en: The enemy will invariably seek opportunities to assert himself.
sentences.cn: 敌人是一定要寻找机会表现他们自己的.

sentences.en: The needs of patients invariably overlap.
sentences.cn: 病人的需求总有一些是一致的。

sentences.en: The security guards were invariably ex-servicemen.
sentences.cn: 保安人员毫无例外地都是退伍军人。

sentences.en: They almost invariably get it wrong.
This invariably wins them the love and respect of others.
sentences.cn: 这种行为常常为他们赢得别人的爱戴和尊敬.

sentences.en: Whenever she failed to comprehend she invariably laughed.
sentences.cn: 每当她听不懂的时候，她总是会笑。

words.tran_cn: [数] 不变量；[计] 不变式

trans.tran_en: if something invariably happens or is invariably true, it always happens or is true
